title: Macbook Pro A1706---820-00239
message:
4.9V for sure at R6915?
In such case, check R6910-13 ohm values.
You can play with this resistor divider, to adjust output voltage.

title: Macbook Pro A1706---820-00239
message:
now  PP3V3_G3H = 3.3 volt
but Nothing change 
the Amp meter reads 20v  0.06 A

title: Macbook Pro A1706---820-00239
message:
Do you get 3V3_SUS?
Post PM_PWRBTN_L, PM_RSMRST_L, PM_BATLOW_L, PM_DSW_PWRGD.

title: Macbook Pro A1706---820-00239
message: 3.3 volt on all the points

title: Macbook Pro A1706---820-00239
message: is it normal ?  PP5V_S4 = 0 Volt

title: Macbook Pro A1706---820-00239
message:
Is SMC_ONOFF_L steady high?
If not, disconnect TouchID and check again.
If yes, trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L at same time.
Be sure PM_RSMRST_L remains high all the time.

title: Macbook Pro A1706---820-00239
message:
i dont understand what do u mean by  trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L at same time.
smc_onoff_l is high 3.3 volt
PM_RSMRST_L   high all the time

title: Macbook Pro A1706---820-00239
message:
i dont understand what do u mean by trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L at same time.
smc_onoff_l is high 3.3 volt
PM_RSMRST_L high all the time

title: Macbook Pro A1706---820-00239
message:
"i dont understand what do u mean by trigger SMC_ONOFF_L"
You should, as we talk such many times about that on the forum.
Read more threads, you can find lot of information.

I mean to press power button.
However, to work with board alone on the desk, use a pad or test point for SMC_ONOFF_L to solder an wire and temporary touch ground with it.
R5225/6 pads are good enough...

title: Macbook Pro A1706---820-00239
message:
update
after  trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L at same time.(from 3.3volt to 0.3 volt)
 PM_RSMRST_L remains high all the time. (3.3 volt)
nothing change  on the usb meter ( 20.1 volt  - 0.06 A)

title: Macbook Pro A1706---820-00239
message: Check if all PM_SLP_Sx_L signals pulse at same time.

title: Macbook Pro A1706---820-00239
message:
PM_SLP_S5_L = 3.3
PM_SLP_S4_L = 0
PM_SLP_S3_L = 0
PM_SLP_S0_L = 3.3
PM_SLP_SUS_L = 3.3

title: Macbook Pro A1706---820-00239
message:
No pulse at all at PM_SLP_S4_L for sure?
In such case, there is PCH related problem.

title: Macbook Pro A1706---820-00239
message:
Sure no pulse at PM_SLP_S4_L
RTC_RESET_L =  3 v
PCH_SRTCRST_L = 2.9 V
PCH_INTRUDER_L = 1.5 V
PPDCPRTC_PCH  =  1.1 V
PM_DSW_PWRGD =  3.3 v
PPV0PCH_REG_R = 0.9 V
PP1V_PCH_REG_R=1.5 V
voltage on big coil L7030 Cant detected  changed from 25 to 31 TBA phase 2

title: Macbook Pro A1706---820-00239
message: is it pch??

title: Macbook Pro A1706---820-00239
message:
"PCH_INTRUDER_L = 1.5 V"
There is a problem.
You can force the signal, lowering its resistor; 100K, instead of 1M.

title: Macbook Pro A1706---820-00239
message:
now  PCH_INTRUDER_L  = 3 V
nothing change (20 v   0.06 A)

title: Macbook Pro A1706---820-00239
message:
"Check if all PM_SLP_Sx_L signals pulse at same time."
Test again...

title: Macbook Pro A1706---820-00239
message:
no 
the same reading

title: Macbook Pro A1706---820-00239
message:
Check again RTC signals.
Probably bad PCH, as it sinks to much on PCH_INTRUDER_L line.

title: Macbook Pro A1706---820-00239
message: INTRUDER# has a very weak pull-up (1M), if you touch the probes skin resistance is enough to pull down the voltage a lot (like less than 1.5V). Even without touching the probes the internal impedance of the DMM (typically around 10M) will cause it to drop to around 3.0V.

title: Macbook Pro A1706---820-00239
message:
I never saw it under 2.4V checking with voltmeter on good board.
A good voltmeter cannot drop it until 1.5V...
